concept.title: Using Filters to find a Report

conbody.p: As the number of reports you create increases, it will be useful to group the reports into different categories. You can create different category tags and apply them to the reports you create. This will help you manage your reports and find them more quickly. If a report falls into multiple categories, you can apply multiple category tags to the same report.
You can use any of the following methods described below to narrow down and retrieve a specific report for viewing.

li.p: You can select a tag by clicking in the -- filter by tags -- drop-down list and select a tag (category) under which the report is categorized. For example, in the screenshot below, selecting the tag Administrative Reports narrows the list of reports to those categorized as administrative reports. Figure 2-12-1

p.note: You can repeat the process to filter the list by multiple tags.

li.p:
Click in the Report Name filter and type part of a name of a report that you want to find. All the reports having the search text as part of their name are listed. For example, typing schema in the Report Name filter resulted in three reports in the list having schema in their names. Figure 2-12-2
Similarly, you can type the username of the owner in the Owner filter and get the list of reports owned by the user. The following filter shows the list of reports owned by the user test1. Figure 2-12-3
li.note: The Report Name is case-sensitive. The list of reports will be filtered by reports with the same string in their name as what you typed.

li.p: Filter for reports created in a specific date range using the Last Updated field. Click in the filter field to get the Date Range Selection dialog. Clicking the in the Start Data and End Date of the data range in the date calculator pop up dialog. You can also narrow the Hour, Minute, Second granularity as required. The screeshot below shows the date range selector with the date calculator. Figure 2-12-4

conbody.p: You can add, remove, or modify the tag (category) list. To add a new tag, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Click . The Edit Tags dialog displays.
Enter a new tag name in the Add a tag text box.
Click Add. The new tag appears in the list of tags.

conbody.p: To edit an existing tag name, perform the following:

ul.li: Click . The Edit Tags dialog displays.
Double click the tag name you want to edit. The tag is highlighted in the text box.
Edit the tag name and press Enter. The tag name gets updated.Any reports tagged with the previous tag name are also updated and tagged with the new name.

conbody.p: To delete a tag name, perform the following:

ul.li: Click . The Edit Tags dialog displays.

Click in the Delete column of the tag name you want to delete.

If the tag name is not in use, it is deleted from the list.
